summary: This bill, H.R. 2522, aims to designate a portion of 18th Street Northwest in Washington, D.C., as "Jimmy Lai Way" in honor of the imprisoned Hong Kong democracy advocate. The bill condemns Lai's imprisonment and mistreatment, calls for his release, and supports freedom of speech and the press in Hong Kong. It also includes provisions for official address changes and the placement of street signs. Further, the bill expresses a sense of Congress regarding mail delivery to the Hong Kong Economic and Trade Office in the U.S.
